sentence_samples.sentence: Hey guys, could somebody help me understand how to deal with array of observables? e

sentence_samples.sentence: I have array of http requests: [<-CODE->] I want to send these requests one after another. Thanks!e

sentence_samples.speaker: ghetolay
sentence_samples.sentence: marcincichocki: from([1, 2, 3]).concatMap(step => this.http.get())e

sentence_samples.speaker: ghetolay
sentence_samples.sentence: concatMap will hold everything until the inner observable (the get()) has finished.e

sentence_samples.speaker: ghetolay
sentence_samples.sentence: it's mergeMap with a concurrency of 1e

sentence_samples.speaker: zarashima
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi all, anyone knows which is the best approach to verify if the input field does not accept special characters, e.g: "$#@%%^&*(" , either on Android or iOS? For example, I have an input field that only accepts numeric characters, any other special characters besides allowed characters are not sent to the field no matter what users pressing on the keyboard itself. I try to use 'Send Keys' function and then assert the input field's text equals blank (input values are not filled), but Appium can still send the restricted characters successfully.

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: @zarashima To be honest: this should be a unit test and not a UI test, because this is very time consuming. It also needs to be an API test, because people can still adjust frontend code (if it's a frontend app) and send different chars through the API. it's also good to know how the filtering is done, if this is done for example with HTML and a specific attribute, like for example <input type="number" > then you shouldn't even test it because this is default behavior, if it's broken, the it's broken for the whole world. There are also some functions for that for native code. Check the risk and business value. I'd always advice to avoid these type of tests through the UI, especially on mobile because they are 3-6 times slower than on desktop browsers

sentence_samples.speaker: zarashima
sentence_samples.sentence: ok thanks @wswebcreation

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: I am getting an issue while launching the app. When I have launch then it launch twice. Can anyone please let me know why this problem happens?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: @surendraims Is this happening all the time, or only on startup?e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: @Wim Selles Everytime while launching the app.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: when is that? When starting your first testcase?e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: Yes. When starting first test case.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: Appium opens the app automatically when you start a session, so if you also open your app in your first testcase you have it double. You can't disable Appium to open the app on startupe

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: Means?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: you need to handle this yourself for the first testcasee

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: I have one more question- Suppose I have 3 test cases when I have run all 3 test case then in each test case app launch. So how we can stop this thing?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: You need to handle that yourself and also look at this [<-URL->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: I want like if I have launched app onces then all test case execute without launching app again and again. Ok let me check. I already did that. but problem is still happens.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: What framework are you using?e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: I am using opentest. [<-CODE->] these two capabilities I already defined.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: What is opentest?e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: Opentest is a server. If you google it will provide all info.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: Same for all Appium questions e

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: Yese

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: Based on what I read and how I think it will work is that OpenTest is pulling up a driver between each test and also closes the driver after a test. This might cause your issue. Please refer to the OpenTest community on how to handle that in the test appe

sentence_samples.speaker: surendraims
sentence_samples.sentence: I am getting two error one is app launch twice and second one if I execute multiple test cases then everytime app gets launched. So I have to handle these two issue. But no clue is there.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wswebcreation
sentence_samples.sentence: Yeah, this is the Appium support channel, not the OpenTest support channel. We can provide you with help with Appium but we don't know what a framework is adding for additional features on top of Appiume

sentence_samples.speaker: andythompson89
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi All. I'm new to Appium and am really struggling to get it working on Mac. We're building our app in Xamarin and exporting the APKs and IPAs from there. I've managed to get it to work on Android on my windows PC, but I can seem to find the right file to build the app on the Mac. The closest I've got is using an IPA which made the splashscreen come onto the screen and disappear 3 times, but I can't get any further than that... Any help would be much appreciated! And just to note - I'm not a developer so please bear with me if I don't understand some of the more technical things. Thanks in advance. [<-URL->] That's the exact problem we're having, as posted by one of our developers.e

sentence_samples.speaker: Abriti15

sentence_samples.speaker: andythompson89
sentence_samples.sentence: @Abriti15 - it's a simulator at this stage...e

sentence_samples.speaker: Abriti15
sentence_samples.sentence: @andythompson89 I think ipa files are meant for actual devices. For simulators you would need .app filee

sentence_samples.speaker: andythompson89
sentence_samples.sentence: Ah cool I wasn't aware of that, thank you... I'll try that approach. I recall looking for that file a while ago and not being able to find it. Would you be able to point me in the direction of a folder structure that i can look in on the build device?e

sentence_samples.speaker: Abriti15
sentence_samples.sentence: @andythompson89 Are you using xcode to build the code?e

sentence_samples.speaker: andythompson89

sentence_samples.speaker: Abriti15

I have faced similar issue while trying to run an ipa code on a simulatore

sentence_samples.speaker: andythompson89
sentence_samples.sentence: OK I can try that, thanks for the info... Any idea how we should be building it if we intend to run tests on an emulator?e

sentence_samples.speaker: Abriti15
sentence_samples.sentence: @andythompson89 I do it from xcode directly...U can select the device against the app and build the code...it will generate .app file...either for a real device or simulator. But the version for real device wont work on simulator and vice versae

sentence_samples.speaker: ghost~57cbaf6040f3a6eec0634f49
sentence_samples.sentence: What is the use of docker?

sentence_samples.speaker: ghost~57cbaf6040f3a6eec0634f49
sentence_samples.sentence: Can anyone explain about it in a very simple lang?

sentence_samples.speaker: SISheogorath
sentence_samples.sentence: dpnashsh: Docker is an container engine (means it isolates applications) and orchestration system (means it places applications on various hosts and makes sure there is a fail over when a host dies). It provides all tooling to create such containers. Means you can download images of applications and/or build them yourself in a reproducable way using Dockerfiles. This way docker allows you to manage the entire workflow of a application building to deployment.

sentence_samples.speaker: shahbazn
sentence_samples.sentence: If i am building FROM a base docker image and that base image starts an nginx process with its entrypoint script. Now I add an entrypoint script to fill a few config files from env variables and before the base image calls its entrypoint script. So my question does adding a new entrypoint script override the base image's entrypoint script or does it add another layer on the docker image and execute both layer first the new layer and then base images?e

sentence_samples.speaker: SISheogorath
sentence_samples.sentence: it'll overwrite the ENTRYPOINT script of the base image, yese

sentence_samples.speaker: SISheogorath
sentence_samples.sentence: if you want to extend it, just source the original entrypoint script :) make sure you use the same shell interpreter so it works finee

sentence_samples.speaker: shahbazn
sentence_samples.sentence: SISheogorath: thanks that helpse

sentence_samples.speaker: AnorakTech_twitter
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi there. I have a 2 docker containers running. Is it possible to move one image/container to another partition? I want to keep the first container in the default /var/lib/docker folder, but move the 2nd one to another place.

sentence_samples.speaker: SISheogorath
sentence_samples.sentence: AnorakTech_twitter: no. Container always run stateless in your docker directory which is when you don't do fundamental changes in/var/lib/docker. What you can change is the location of your volumes. But only when you use bind mounts or a non-default volume driver

sentence_samples.speaker: AnorakTech_twitter
sentence_samples.sentence: Cool, thanks.

sentence_samples.speaker: outkaj
sentence_samples.sentence: Hello! What is the most straightforward method/utility to back up a running container with its volume directory? (I'd like to avoid something like:docker commit, create an intermediate container, copy the volume into the intermediate container and tar it, untar it into the committed version, etc, if possible), as I have to do this a number of times.

sentence_samples.speaker: SISheogorath
sentence_samples.sentence: outkaj: you shouldn't need to backup the container itself. Only the volumes. There it highly depends on your filesystem underneath. If you go for a storage system, snapshot the filesystem but make sure you don't have some caching in-between as NFS does. If you run on a local filesystem or a NAS you sadly have to stop the container, make a copy, start it again. At least when you want it reliable. If you have less stateful data you can also copy it on the fly, but it's risky. Given the luck that you run btrfs or zfs underneath you can also simply use their snapshot featues.

sentence_samples.speaker: outkaj
sentence_samples.sentence: SISheogorath: thank you for the thorough answer! that is very helpful and it makes sense re: needing to stop the container, as well.

sentence_samples.sentence: I am trying to setup Jenkins in a docker container, now for my understanding if I run it with port exposure 8080:8080 then connecting to the host ip:8080 I should see the jenkins instance running in the container right?

sentence_samples.speaker: LanderU
sentence_samples.sentence: is this port available in your system?

sentence_samples.speaker: LanderU
sentence_samples.sentence: docker run -p 8080:8080 -p 50000:50000 -v /your/home:/var/jenkins_home jenkins

sentence_samples.speaker: pete013
sentence_samples.sentence: Hello! Need some help here.I have hosted a docker container in a windows 10 enterprise system. The issue is that the Docker for Windows was run using a windows user account. After a few hours, the windows user logs out automatically, also the docker daemon is shutdown. However the system is still on.I need the docker daemon to remain running even after the user logs out.How to do that?Thankse

sentence_samples.speaker: mantoshelis
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi, it's impossible because on user log out everything related with user (processes and etc.) is shut down.e

sentence_samples.speaker: mantoshelis
sentence_samples.sentence: Docker daemon should be as a service so it does not depend on user started it.e

sentence_samples.speaker: pete013
sentence_samples.sentence: Is there some way to run the docker daemon as system process?e

sentence_samples.speaker: mantoshelis
sentence_samples.sentence: [<-LINK->] e

sentence_samples.speaker: pete013
sentence_samples.sentence: Are there no configuration options in Docker?e

sentence_samples.speaker: mantoshelis
sentence_samples.sentence: I think is not Docker scope how you run it (process or system service).e

sentence_samples.speaker: mantoshelis
sentence_samples.sentence: As I see there should be registered Docker service in service list on Windows. You could change it to Autostart (delayed).e

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi team, I run into a behaviour I don't understand with tmpfs. I create a dockerfile where I create a directory in /run and set some permissions. Then I docker run with a tmpfs over /run and my directory is gone. I expected the existing directory would still exist.

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: Is my understanding wrong or is it just as designed? I can't see a way to use tmpfs the way it is since only root can write to it.

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: The example give where you use mount does not work either, the mode is always 755 no matter what tmpfs-mode is set to

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: My docker version is:

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: Client: Version:           18.06.0-ce API version:       1.38 Go version:        go1.10.3 Git commit:        0ffa825 Built:             Wed Jul 18 19:09:33 2018 OS/Arch:           linux/amd64 Experimental:      falseServer: Engine:  Version:          18.06.0-ce  API version:      1.38 (minimum version 1.12)  Go version:       go1.10.3  Git commit:       0ffa825  Built:            Wed Jul 18 19:13:46 2018  OS/Arch:          linux/amd64  Experimental:     false

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: Is there any way to use tmpfs mounts without being root?

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: anyone home?

sentence_samples.speaker: rcjsuen
sentence_samples.sentence: I've never used tmpfs before. What are you trying to achieve and why are you choosing to use tmpfs?

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: I want to run with read-only fs and use tmpfs for things like /run and /tmp

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: So that the system can actually do something useful, but I found that tmpfs has 750 permissions for root only, so that means that you either run as root OR use tmpfs, but not both

sentence_samples.speaker: mterron
sentence_samples.sentence: That'd be fine if Docker recreated the existing directories within /run with the correct permissions, but it just mounts an empty dir

sentence_samples.speaker: saleemepoch
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi all, I am new to docker and I need some help with setting static IPs to my containers using docker-compose.  Here is my yaml config: [<-LINK->]. So doing docker-compose up -d starts up fine and I can see the network created and containers attached. However, when I run a command like so: $ docker-compose run wordpress lsI get:Error response from daemon: Address already in useI am using docker toolbox on Windows 10 (Don't want to enable Hyper-V, I want to keep vagrant).Any idea what's the problem here? It goes without saying the containers are unreachable.e

sentence_samples.speaker: saleemepoch
sentence_samples.sentence: someone from freenode explained to me that docker-compose run creates a new container to run a command, and since a container with that IP already exists it throws Address already in use error.e

sentence_samples.speaker: saleemepoch
sentence_samples.sentence: To run a command in an existing container I should use exece

sentence_samples.speaker: saleemepoch
sentence_samples.sentence: So this is sorted. The original issue remains: why am I not able to reach the container?e

sentence_samples.speaker: saleemepoch
sentence_samples.sentence: $ curl 10.5.0.5curl: (7) Failed to connect to 10.5.0.5 port 80: Timed oute

sentence_samples.speaker: mateothegreat
sentence_samples.sentence: saleemepoch: try localhoste

sentence_samples.speaker: bitbythecron
sentence_samples.sentence: hi everyone (hopefully) quick question. my understanding (please keep me honest!) is that in DL4J (and most other ML/DL frameworks), all of a particular neural network's configurations (layers, weights, misc parameters) are just data configurations, and as such, can be saved to disk in a file. that way, I can tune a network to work exactly how I want it, store its configs/settings in a file, and then reload that file at a later time to reproduce the exact same network later on. if this is true (and correct me if its not!) then it occurred to me that it would be super helpful if these "network config files" had a standard format. that way, I could train a network to learn how to spot a bowling ball in an image using one framework/language/API, export the file, and use it down the road in another project that perhaps uses a totally different tech stack. but because both frameworks support this open standard, both would be capable of loading and configuring the exact same neural network that will correctly identify "bowling balls" in an image. does such a standard file format exist, and does DL4J support it? thanks! ONNX perhaps?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: ONNX is the closest thing out there to a universal format. But it doesn’t support everything.e

sentence_samples.speaker: bitbythecron
sentence_samples.sentence: Thanks @wmeddie , googling DL4J + ONNX I see some evidence of support for it in DL4J but its mostly just javadocs that pop up. do you know if DL4J allows for ONNX-based exports, and if so, how comprehensive/developed that feature is?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: Not sure if we have export yet. But import is coming.e

sentence_samples.speaker: bitbythecron
sentence_samples.sentence: Thanks, and finally: is it fair to say that DL4J stores more network features/params/settings/etc. in its own serialization mechanism than what ONNX currently supports?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: Hard to say... ONNX does support quite a lot of ops right now. I’m pretty sure SameDiff has more ops than ONNX supports, but for the high level layers in DL4J... I would guess it has them all.e

sentence_samples.speaker: bitbythecron
sentence_samples.sentence: ahh, SameDiff is what DL4J uses then?e

sentence_samples.speaker: DonaldAlan
sentence_samples.sentence: This question may be inappropriate. In my string representation for music, I use, for example, ASCII char 33 to represent a duration of one beat, 34 = two beats, 35 = three beats, etc. Will LSTM take advantage of the numeric proximity of those characters in its learning? Or does it treat the various characters as unordered?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: My guess is that the one hot input is essentially unordered to the internal layers. Each one gets mapped to a unique weight in the first layer.e

sentence_samples.speaker: DonaldAlan
sentence_samples.sentence: With a ComputationGraph I could wire input duration nodes to later layers, right? Any good examples of something like that?e

sentence_samples.speaker: DonaldAlan
sentence_samples.sentence: I'm surprised there are no GAN implementations in dl4j.e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: I have one [<-URL->].But haven’t looked at it in a long time.e

sentence_samples.speaker: DonaldAlan
sentence_samples.sentence: Will Transformers be added?e

sentence_samples.speaker: wmeddie
sentence_samples.sentence: We have self attention layers. I do believe we have everything you need to make one.e

sentence_samples.speaker: AndreaGraz
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi, I'm using DL4j with the model zoo Darknet19 where I remove the GlobalPoolingLayer, It works fine with images up to 3000x3000 pixels. But when I run images bigger than 3200x3200 it gives me unexpected outputs. Is there a limit of floats I can input DL4j? Seems like is clipping out floats, is something related to the image sizee

sentence_samples.speaker: AndreaGraz
sentence_samples.sentence: Ubuntu 18.04, Java 1.8, Maven 3.6.0, Scala 2.11.12e

sentence_samples.speaker: saudet
sentence_samples.sentence: @AndreaGraz please try with 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT and if it still fails, please open an !issue with code and datae

sentence_samples.speaker: KolyaIvankov
sentence_samples.sentence: @AndreaGraz Your pics are resized to fit Darknet19 input layer, and on big pictures it seems that bounding box predictions simply give you NAs. I don't quite think that image size has anything to do with your network topology.e

sentence_samples.speaker: keeyan_gitlab
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi guys :) I've just started to use DL4J and I came into an issue with the quickstart page ([<-URL->]). According to the prerequisites we should have version 0.9.1 installed for the tutorials. However if I install that version and run the code I get an issue saying not enough arguments for method layer (I can expand on the error if needed). It turns out the reason for this is that ListBuilder only has one method for layer which takes an int followed by a Layer. Once I updated to 1.0.0-beta2 it seems to be working now. I'm thinking the tutorials may need updating so that users install the correct version. (P.S if I use beta5 I get different errors. So it was really just guess work for me to install the right version)e

sentence_samples.speaker: ari62
sentence_samples.sentence: @keeyan_gitlab yes the tutorials are all old versions of dl4je

sentence_samples.speaker: keeyan_gitlab
sentence_samples.sentence: @ari62 thanks. But the version it's asking for in the prerequisites is 0.9.1 yet the code doesn't run with that version and only works with 1.0.0-beta2. Has the code in the tutorials been updated without the version number in the prerequisites being updated? Also what version should users be using? I would assume 0.9.1 since everything else is beta. But at the same time on the website you link to 1.0.0-beta4. If I click on docs it takes me to a page with latest in the title. But which version is that documentation for? (sorry for all the questions but I'm a bit confused about the versions)e

sentence_samples.speaker: ari62
sentence_samples.sentence: @keeyan_gitlab not sure what version the docs are for, I just know that I had to look at the actual code to see the API, same as you, because the docs were incorrect. If anyone would like to look at an end-to-end example kaggle competition project i built: [<-URL->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: keeyan_gitlab
sentence_samples.sentence: Yeah it's a shame. It looks like a nice framework (and the only real option for Java) but having incorrect docs and tutorials can really make it a pain. I don't really like having to look at the source code to figure out what's going one

sentence_samples.speaker: ZagButNoZig
sentence_samples.sentence: Does Dl4j automatically clear unused nd arrays? Because I am working on a genetic algorithm which runs multiple networks at the same time for multiple generations and after a few runs i get a out of memory exception? Or is it just the networks overflowing the memory?e

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @ZagButNoZig DL4J uses (by default) a workspace memory management strategy. we're not reliant on garbage collection or anything for the activations/gradients (forward/backward pass). so memory use should be flat during training and inference but we are reliant on garbage collection to clean up any network parameters memory (and workspace memory) for networks you've finished with (and have cleared all references to so they can be garbage collected)e

sentence_samples.speaker: ZagButNoZig
sentence_samples.sentence: Is there a way to make networks more "lightweight" because in a GA having multiple gigabytes of memory per network is quite heavy. The network only has 124 params.e

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @ZagButNoZig the only way you can get multiple GB of memory use from a tiny network is if you have huge activations (like CNN with like 1000x1000 images or whatever) or huge minibatch sizee

sentence_samples.speaker: ZagButNoZig
sentence_samples.sentence: @AlexDBlack I have one network / thread getting fed a 3 x 5 x 5 per game step. Anything suspicious ? Because they get fed a lot of data but not at the same time. And I am at 4.8 GB of memorye

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: and you're sure you are not leaking array references somewhere, or have loaded multiple GB into memory? even if it was somehow from the network (detached arrays - i.e., those not in workspaces) it would be cleaned up by garbage collector. you can check memory use using [<-CODE->] method too, might show you something usefule

sentence_samples.speaker: ZagButNoZig
sentence_samples.sentence: To get the 3x5x5 gamestate i generate 3 5x5 double arrays then I create 3 ND-Arrays from those double arrays and stack them onto eachother using vstack to then reshape them into one (1x)3x5x5 ND-Array. Does this leak ref.? If so whats a better way of doing that?e

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: that sounds OK. by "leaking array references" I mean you have something (like a list, map, etc) that stores lots of arrays permanently so they can't be garbage collected. if you can't work it out, feel free to open an !issue (with a reproducible example we can run) and we'll take a look when we have timee

sentence_samples.speaker: eriktorngren

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @eriktorngren usually for that you would use a multi-task network (computation graph with multiple output layers). one output layer configured for regression (the doubles), and one (or more) for the categorical values

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @mankeskes unfortunately we dropped CUDA support on Mac in 1.0.0-beta4. [<-URL->] given Apple hasn't supported NVIDIA cards in their machines for many years, we decided to drop support to minimize development and release overheads. we're not the only library to do this, tensorflow doesn't release an OSX CUDA version either, for examplee

sentence_samples.sentence: @mattsilv7384 There is a revert method to denormaize a data array. See: https://deeplearning4j.org/docs/latest/datavec-normalization. Your second question is at best generic deep learning, unless you are trying to predict simple trends or cycles, it will not work.e

sentence_samples.speaker: nvinayvarma189
sentence_samples.sentence: Hello, I'm using deeplearning4j in a maven project by adding nd4j dependency to my POM file. When I add the dependency, so many jar files are being included. but I only need the following [<-CODE->]. Here are my dependencies: [<-CODE->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: nvinayvarma189
sentence_samples.sentence: The problem is that when I package my code as jar file, the file size is around 300MB. I want to reduce it. Is there any way to exclude all the files which I don't need at once? yes @cowwoc . all the openblas jar files for different os are being included.e

sentence_samples.speaker: nvinayvarma189
sentence_samples.sentence: Do they actually serve a purpose when a user downloads the jar file in a different os system other than mine? I'm using ubuntu to develop the jar file. Will people downloading the jar file on windows or mac require those openblas files?e

sentence_samples.speaker: sshepel
sentence_samples.sentence: @nvinayvarma189 I can be wrong but have you tried to play with classifiers for specific platform? Also, this issue should help: [<-ISSUE->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @nvinayvarma189 first thing: use nd4j-native instead of nd4j-native-platform the "-platform" suffix means "include binaries for all platforms". obviously, that'll save you a ton of space. The downside of that is if (for example) you build on windows and deploy on linux, you won't have linux binaries. Doing that sort of cross-OS deployment with the -platform dependencies will work fine.e

sentence_samples.sentence: @nvinayvarma189  [<-URL->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: wbrege
sentence_samples.sentence: Hey guys! Is there any information around the byte size of an INDArray given the shape and datatype? IE how much memory would a float INDArray of shape 10x10 take up?e

sentence_samples.speaker: AlexDBlack
sentence_samples.sentence: @wbrege as far as the actual off-heap memory, it's just array length (i.e., number of elements, product([<-CODE->]) times size in bytes of each element. each element will be their standard sizes - so 4 bytes for int/float, 8 bytes for long/double, and so on. there's a little bit of overhead on the java side (objects etc), plus the shape buffer (small, immutable, and shared between other arrays of same shape/strides etc) but for large arrays the buffer (i.e., actual array data) takes up the vast majority of the spacee

sentence_samples.speaker: wbrege
sentence_samples.sentence: @AlexDBlack Thank you!e

sentence_samples.sentence: @wbrege as far as the actual off-heap memory, it's just array length (i.e., number of elements, product([<-CODE->]) times size in bytes of each element. each element will be their standard sizes - so 4 bytes for int/float, 8 bytes for long/double, and so on. there's a little bit of overhead on the java side (objects etc), plus the shape buffer (small, immutable, and shared between other arrays of same shape/strides etc) but for large arrays the buffer (i.e., actual array data) takes up the vast majority of the spaceemmmmmmmmmm

sentence_samples.speaker: wbrege
sentence_samples.sentence: @AlexDBlack Thank you!emmmmmmmmmm

sentence_samples.sentence: [<-URL->] Yeah, you can use declaration merging for most stuff. [<-CODE->] Try sticking that in some file and checking if it shows up in Request.user. Although the singleton type True may seem artificial, ... @AnyhowStep Stares at TypeScript and its literal types

sentence_samples.speaker: nspaeth
sentence_samples.sentence: That does seem to work. I was testing it on express.user instead of express.req.user or Request.user. What is causing it to merge with Request instead of being added to express? (Notice how User is a sibling of Request, not a child in the passport typedef)

sentence_samples.speaker: AnyhowStep
sentence_samples.sentence: You're saying req.user does not contain myCustomLabel?

sentence_samples.speaker: nspaeth
sentence_samples.sentence: No, I am saying it does, but that was unexpected for me. I was expecting to be able to do: [<-CODE->] Because User and Request are declared at the same level. I'm just trying to understand how User isn't merged into the rootexpress namespace, but Request is.

sentence_samples.speaker: AnyhowStep
sentence_samples.sentence: Where is this user variable coming from, in your first example? I've never known user to be a property of import * as express from "express"; Then again, it's not like I use express often

sentence_samples.speaker: nspaeth
sentence_samples.sentence: [<-CODE->]

sentence_samples.speaker: AnyhowStep
sentence_samples.sentence: Just use req.user.myCustomField or use Express.User, instead of trying to import {User}

sentence_samples.speaker: nspaeth
sentence_samples.sentence: I understand, but myCustomField isn't part of the express package either. So I was just trying to understand why User didn't get merged into express the same way myCustonField got merged into Request.user. For sure though, [<-CODE->] solves my problem, and I'll be using that.

sentence_samples.speaker: AnyhowStep
sentence_samples.sentence: Because User is not part of the express package. Request is part of the express package, though. express.Request extends express-static-core.Request extends global.Express.Request. So, when you import {Request} from "express", you're importing express.Express. It just so happens that it extends global.Express.Request. But there is no express.User. So, you can't import {User} from "express"

sentence_samples.speaker: nspaeth
sentence_samples.sentence: Ah, I see, thanks.

I could really use a tip on this, I've tried everything I can think of.

sentence_samples.speaker: aaronfay
sentence_samples.sentence: I've tried [<-CODE->]. However I get the error [<-CODE->], I'd like to cast the Model type to MyModel but I can't figure out for the life of me how to do so.

sentence_samples.speaker: 1joshuatz_twitter
sentence_samples.sentence: With that JSDoc, I think you've made dynamicProp a property/field of the class, whereas you wanted it as a property of the schema obj passed to constructor. Also, why not just annotate on the constructor? [<-CODE->]

sentence_samples.speaker: aaronfay
sentence_samples.sentence: @1joshuatz_twitter I'm trying to provide type annotations in this scenario: [<-CODE->]. In this case, annotations on the constructor don't help, each schema can be different. I should be able to see completion for modelA.dynamicProp and modelB.otherProp, that's what I'm struggling to implement.

sentence_samples.speaker: 1joshuatz_twitter
sentence_samples.sentence: Sorry, I wish I had an answer, but I think what you are asking might not even be possible, and IMHO, kind of goes against how static type checking works. If an object is allowed to have a key of arbitrary name assigned with any value at runtime, I don't see how or why the checker would infer a type other than "any". For example, see - [<-URL->] Even in native typescript, if I explicitly state that a class can have dynamically assigned members, the best I believe I can get back is "any" as the type for new dynamically assigned members. TS is really good at inferring types within the class, as long as they are in actual code and not assigned dynamically, so you could maybe get around this if dynamicProp and otherProp are strings out of an allowedPropsName array or something like that. This talks about how types are inferred within classes - [<-URL->]. Maybe this is also possible using generics... looks like VSCode supports the @template JSDoc, but that is above my current level of experience. I'd love to see if anyone else has a solution for this, or if you find one!

sentence_samples.speaker: aaronfay
sentence_samples.sentence: @1joshuatz_twitter thanks for your thoughts. We considered TS when we made some major changes to the code base, but settled on an in-house "type validation" system using JSON Schema (Draft 4), so it's not really "anything goes", the models have a fixed schema, the schema is picked up by the super class and the properties are added at that point, but they're really hard to annotate. I converted the schemas to TS interfaces but had limited luck getting my code to infer those types as well. I'll definitely take another look at @template, I've glanced at it a few times but I don't fully understand it's purpose. I'll take another look.  thanks again

sentence_samples.speaker: 1joshuatz_twitter
sentence_samples.sentence: @aaronfay No problem, and best of luck on that!

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: Ambient context = .d.ts. It’s just types so you can describe methods there, but you can’t implement theme

sentence_samples.speaker: David-OConnor
sentence_samples.sentence: It is indeed a .d.ts. What's the difference between describe and implement?e

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: Describe = what types are the parameters and return type. Implement = actual codee

sentence_samples.speaker: David-OConnor
sentence_samples.sentence: Oh, thank you! I renamed the file to .ts and it's working now! Much appreciated. Do I lost anything by doing this?e

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: .d.ts is if you need to describe the typeS of code that’s already writtene

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: Like JS code, e.g. If you’re writing TS code, use .ts. Since you mentioned structs: .d.ts is like a header file except it can only contain declarations, no logice

sentence_samples.speaker: David-OConnor
sentence_samples.sentence: Thank you very much. I'm not sure which category this falls into, but essentially I am describing types, but now want to add methods to the types. I'm not sure what a header is (Not experienced with C), but I've been using this .d.ts file to store interfacese

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: If you need to write code with the methods, use .tse

sentence_samples.sentence: Thank you - completely solvede

sentence_samples.speaker: keithlayne

sentence_samples.speaker: keithlayne
sentence_samples.sentence: as const makes it a tuple

sentence_samples.speaker: jmptr
sentence_samples.sentence: what does [number] mean?

sentence_samples.speaker: orta
sentence_samples.sentence: it’s a tuple: [<-URL->]

sentence_samples.speaker: keithlayne
sentence_samples.sentence: I think he means the indexing of a tuple above

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: It's an index type - T[K], given obj :: T and key :: K (you don't know which key), what type do I get if I do obj[key]

sentence_samples.speaker: jmptr
sentence_samples.sentence: got it, I'm telling TSC to index by number

sentence_samples.speaker: fatcerberus
sentence_samples.sentence: If it makes it clearer: (typeof keys)[number]. Which gives you the union of all types in the tuple. @orta I'm lacking context here - already tried scrolling up but didn't notice anything relevant... what are you talking about compressing compiler options? @reggi So you're in a bit of a catch-22 here. If you mark the parameter as required, then you always have to specify it. But if you mark it optional, the implicit undefined in its type doesn't contribute to inference. I'm trying to think of a way around it but I'm not sure there is one. Maybe overloads?

sentence_samples.speaker: keithlayne
sentence_samples.sentence: @fatcerberus I think maybe he means collapsing the compiler options section by default @jmptr you probably already got this but typeof keys[0] would be the first item, but number is the union of all numbers, so when you index with numberyou get the union of all values.

sentence_samples.speaker: tomenden
sentence_samples.sentence: Hi, I have a question regarding monaco-editor, hoping this is a good place to ask. I'm trying to figure out the best way to achieve what I want - I need typescript support, but I also need some fine grain control to put some sugar on typescript (e.g when certain types of completions are requested I want a custom behavior, etc.). Monaco-typescript, which is a great package, takes me some way, but it does not allow fine-grained control (plus other limitations coming from the fact it's focused on single files). I was hoping to use LSP, but I was unable to find a typeacript LSP solution in a web worker, and I want it to run on the client. Can someone help me figure out the best approach? Is there an LSP for tyescript in web workers that I missed? Is my best bet forking monaco-typescripy and extending/modifying it? Thanks in advance!

sentence_samples.speaker: Gerrit0
sentence_samples.sentence: Have you looked at the completion API for Monaco [<-URL->] ?

sentence_samples.speaker: tomenden
sentence_samples.sentence: Yes, and it can work, but I mostly want typescript support, plus some additions. That's why I prefered if there was already a full blown solution that I could wrap/extend. I saw that there is an issue in monaco-typescript in which one of the maintainers suggests forking it as an option

sentence_samples.speaker: Gerrit0
sentence_samples.sentence: It seems like you should be able to use typescript-monaco and just add a custom completer on top of it... I'm not very familiar with it

sentence_samples.speaker: tomenden
sentence_samples.sentence: I think an LSP implementation would be better, but as I said, can't find an implementationfor web workers... Oh, that's actually interesting, I wonder how it will work. If I register another e.g completion provider, how will the two behave together? Will I be able to override behavior from one (e.g in case a condition is met return something which is not the TS completion, else -> TS)

sentence_samples.speaker: Gerrit0
sentence_samples.sentence: For that I bet you'd have to unregister the existing TS completion and re-register a wrapper that calls it, I would expect Monaco to call each completion provider in turn and use the union of their return values to present completions... I haven't played with it though. Closest I've gotten to Monaco is turning on an option that was causing a bunch of errors since it was missing.

sentence_samples.sentence: Hi guys, how can I solve this error in typescript in function, when I hover on function.. [<-LINK->] and the error is  [<-CODE->]e

sentence_samples.speaker: SalathielGenese
sentence_samples.sentence: @shekharramola I think your answer lies in Function Parameter Bivariance When comparing the types of function parameters, assignment succeeds if either the source parameter is assignable to the target parameter, or vice versa. This is unsound because a caller might end up being given a function that takes a more specialized type, but invokes the function with a less specialized type. In practice, this sort of error is rare, and allowing this enables many common JavaScript patterns.e
